instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-3462: What is 820-3462? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3462</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Memory Module error
threads.message:
I have a 3462 board I was able to bring back from the dead. Significant liquid damage. I'm able to get it to boot from external. Seems to run well. Battery still needs to be replaced so wasn't able to completely see how it might perform. 

It will not allow an OS to complete installation on internal. 

I believe this is due to a memory module error from AHT is [SIZE=4]4mem/60/40000000: 0x7b224f90. 

Any chance anyone knows what RAM chip that references?[/SIZE]

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3462</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Memory Module error
threads.message:
Liquid spill affected more RAM chips probably.
You should reball them all...

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3462</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Memory Module error
threads.message: I was able to get away with just a lots of flux heat and reflow. Memory error is gone and operating system loaded correctly.
